dcterms:description: The ROOTS corpus is a high-quality, heterogeneous, multilingual text corpus collected as part of the BigScience project to train the BLOOM LLM. It consists of 1.6TB of data in 46 natural and 13 programming languages.
dcterms:title: ROOTS corpus

dcterms:creator: Pedro Javier Ortiz Suárez
Laurent Romary
Benoît Sagot
dcterms:description: OSCAR is a dataset identified as a source of a large amount of documents containing personally identifiable information (PII). It has been used in the context of training the BLOOM model.
dcterms:title: OSCAR

dcterms:creator: Geoffrey Neil Leech
dcterms:description: The British National Corpus is a 100 million word corpus of British English, designed to represent the spoken and written language of the late 20th century.
dcterms:title: British National Corpus

dcterms:creator: Colin Raffel
Noam Shazeer
Adam Roberts
Katherine Lee
Sharan Narang
Michael Matena
Yanqi Zhou
Wei Li
Peter J. Liu
dcterms:description: C4 is a dataset used for training language models, noted for its large scale and diverse text content.
dcterms:title: C4

dcterms:creator: Jack Bandy
Nicholas Vincent
dcterms:description: BookCorpus is a dataset that was used for training language models, but was collected without author permissions and has since been taken down.
dcterms:title: BookCorpus

dcterms:description: The Pile is an 800GB dataset of diverse text for language modeling, designed to provide a rich source of training data.
dcterms:title: The Pile

dcterms:creator: Edwin Zhang

dcterms:description: The COVID-19 open research dataset is a collection of research articles and papers related to COVID-19, aimed at facilitating research and information retrieval.
dcterms:title: COVID-19 open research dataset
